_header: Be thee well be thee woe
Note:
Cf. Whiting (1968)
XWhiting, Bartlett Jere. Proverbs, Sentences, and Proverbial Phrases from English Writings Mainly before 1500. Cambridge, MA: Belknap, 1968, M59 (not noting this example).
_description: On the vanity of life — two couplets following ‘Lex et natura…’, which they translate in John Grimestone’s sermon notes

NLS18721.Transcription:
Be þe wel be þe wo be þeself myndeÞat þu
                    dost quiles þu liues þat saltu fyndeChildren ben rekles &
                    wyues vnkinde& seketourus ben fikele & taken þat he
                    finde
NLS18721.Editions:
Wilson,  Edward. 
             A Descriptive Index of the English Lyrics in John of Grimestone’s
                Preaching Book.
Medium Ævum Monographs
         n.s. 2. Oxford, 1973: 19.
